settings.heading: A Childhood Comfort Meal
settings.text:
Growing up in a Filipino household means lots of stews and soups for your meals. I am lucky that both my parents are exceptional home cooks - probably where my love of cooking comes from.

Whenever we were sick or when Winter struck, Arroz Caldo was usually simmering away on the stove.

settings.heading: Ingredients
settings.description:
8-10 c Veggie or Bone Broth
1 c short grain rice
4-5 cloves garlic
1 stalk lemongrass
1-2 inch pieces ginger

Toppings: boiled egg, shredded chicken, fried garlic, scallions, chili oil, chili flakes, lemon/lime, saffron, soy sauce, seaweed, goji berry, roasted mushroom, etc.

settings.heading: Instructions
settings.description:
Chop or Blend your ingredients in a dry, clean mason jar, fill with your herbs.

Add apple cider vinegar and honey in a 3:1 ration (you can also choose a ratio of up to 1:1). 

Cover with parchment paper and then mason jar lid. The parchment paper will prevent corrosion of your lid.

Store for 4-6 weeks in a cool, dry place like a kitchen cabinet. 

Strain and use this immunity building oxymel when feeling under the weather or as a daily shot, as salad dressing, as a marinade! Possibilities are endless.
